intro: Lindackeria paraensis, commonly known as the Paraense lindackeria, is a flowering plant native to the rainforests of Brazil. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its showy, trumpet-shaped flowers that range in color from white to pink. It thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found near streams or in dense undergrowth. Due to habitat loss, it is considered a vulnerable species in its native range.
